column2: @mooncat2878 @Pixelmon Yeah, attention is everything in this space. And it's extremely short lived. If there is no substance behind an NFT/Project like in this case, attention will fade quickly and prices will adjust accordingly.

2/ To counter that there should be:
- Refund periods enforced by the smart contract
- Locked Funds for the team that unlock in stages based upon pre-defined milestones

1/ The Pixelmon disaster shows impressively how bad the current structure of NFT Sales/fund are. 

There is literally no incentive for founders to put in work after the sale because they already received all the funds. https://t.co/2Lt4jAIqi9

RT @MAPACHEGANADOR: @DaBoZzNFT is the boss by name and by facts! @Lev0x_eSports is not the typical VC backed guild only extracting value, w‚Ä¶
RT @Lev0x_Onngusta: This is why Lev0x is different from many guilds , you can call us as guild , an eSports team ,but we are a strong commu‚Ä¶

So if you are an aspiring game looking to partner with us, reach out before your raise/mint and not after the fact to urge us to buy on secondary for massive premiums from your favorite VC guilds. We wont be their exit liquidity.
We are a private guild and currently 70 members strong. We are Investors and Builders. Our purchase power exceeds most of the largest corporate guilds that you know.

Lev0x is about creating a network, a family that helps each other and offers opportunities to each member in the form of shared knowledge and experiences in regards to NFT games. We are friends, investors and gamers that embark this journey together.

In the case of Lev0x, we didnt raise any money. We invest our own money and thus have way higher conviction in the games we go into. Of course we are also investing to make a profit. But, we are builders and will build alongside these games because our incentives are aligned.

They dont invest their own money, hence they dont have the conviction in your game other people have that invest personal funds. Thats why I believe that guilds like @Lev0x_eSports , @realdealguild and others will be more and more important for games.

This is true. Many of the newly formed corporate guilds with VC backing are money extraction machines with zero conviction in the games they invest. Many of them are structured after a top-down approach - a few people on top and a massive amount of scholars as bottom feeders. https://t.co/6DMAMGyJRM
